solution_line_template: First find the total number of vehicles Carmen counted: {num_trucks} trucks + {num_cars} cars = <<{num_trucks}+{num_cars}={total_vehicles}>>{total_vehicles} vehicles
Then find the number of trucks that were red: {num_trucks} trucks / {red_truck_divisor} = <<{num_trucks}/{red_truck_divisor}={red_trucks}>>{red_trucks} trucks
Then find the number of trucks that were black: {num_trucks} trucks * {black_truck_percentage} = <<{num_trucks}*{black_truck_percentage}={black_trucks}>>{black_trucks} trucks

Then subtract the red and black trucks from the total number of trucks to find the number of white trucks: {num_trucks} trucks - {red_trucks} trucks - {black_trucks} trucks = <<{num_trucks}-{red_trucks}-{black_trucks}={white_trucks}>>{white_trucks} trucks

Then divide the number of white trucks by the number of vehicles and multiply by {percent_multiplier}% to find the percentage of vehicles that are white trucks: {white_trucks} trucks / {total_vehicles} vehicles * {percent_multiplier}% = 16.66...%, which rounds up to {white_truck_percentage}%.
